title: Inforcement of civil restraining order at Bradly Airport

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Request Type:
Legal Affairs
Contact E-Mail:
johnnyconrad34@gmail.com
Reference No:
F004675-091825
Status:
LAU-Other Records Pending
Balance Due:
$0.00 
Payments:
$0.00 
Legal Affairs Page

The Department of Emergency Services and Public Protection is comprised of six divisions: The Commission on Fire Prevention and Control, Connecticut State Police, Emergency Management and Homeland Security, Police Officers Standards and Training Council, Division of Scientific Services and Statewide Emergency Telecommunications. The Legal Affairs Units handles FOI requests for all divisions. Examples of materials that can be requested here are audio recordings, video recordings, internal affairs records, lab reports, etc.

If you need to request a Connecticut State Police incident or accident report, you must submit a request through our Reports and Records Unit.

If you need to access Criminal History Record searches or Fingerprinting Services, please click here.

If you need to request a list detailing all state police encounters with an individual or at a specific location, please select run-off from the list below and provide the requested information. We can search back to 2003.

Types of Requests:
Audio Recordings
Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD)
Video Recordings
Other
Requested Audio Materials:
All Audio Transmissions
Requested Video Materials:
Body Camera
In Car Camera
Requester:
Other
Effective 2/1/2025 a new feature has been added for Government entities submitting requests for official business purposes permissible by law.  Please return to the home page and select All Government Entities Only to submit an official government request.  If your request is for personal use, please continue on this page.
Please specify:
involved party
Do not select this option to request a report. If you are seeking a Connecticut State Police incident or accident report, you must submit a request through our Reports and Records Unit.

Case Number:
2500279356
10-digit numeric case number. No letters, dashes or spaces. Example: 2300123456
Your reference, file, or claim number, if applicable:
CFS Number, if applicable:
Type of Incident:
(motor vehicle, accident, domestic, etc.)
 Incident Information
Date of Incident:
08/03/2025
If not known, please approximate
City or Town where incident occurred:
Troop H
Location of Incident:
Provide address if known.
 Involved Party Information
Full Name:
Johnathan Conrad
DOB:
Was there another involved party?:
Yes
Full Name:
Lisette Giacobbe
DOB:
Was there another involved party?:
Please provide a description of the documents you are looking for with as much detail as possible. Provide type of document, involved parties or employees, and date range of material requested:
1. All body-worn camera and in-car/dash-cam video/audio from CSP troopers present. 2. All airport/CSP facility CCTV depicting Johnathan Conrad, Lisette Giacobbe, Sage Conrad, Emelia Conrad, or Amy Shea. 3. All CAD/dispatch logs, unit history, and radio/PSAP recordings. 4. All incident/supplemental reports, referral forms, and custody/juvenile interaction paperwork. 5. Unit rosters/assignment sheets identifying CSP members present. 6. Certified copies in native formats with metadata preserved. Planning/Coordination (June 1 – Aug 4, 2025) 7. All emails, texts, or internal messages referencing or involving Johnathan Conrad, Lisette Giacobbe, Sage Conrad, Emelia Conrad, or Amy Shea. 8. All supervisory notes, debriefs, roll-call notes, or briefing documents regarding this incident. 9. All inter-agency communications with DCF or other agencies. 10. Duty rosters or deployment logs for Troop H/Bradley or other responding units.

  
 
Messages

2
 Print Messages (PDF)
Collapse/Expand
 On 9/18/2025 4:18:28 PM, DESPP Request Center wrote:

desppseal



Dear John Conrad:



Thank you for your interest in public records of Department of Emergency Services and Public Protection. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act and any other applicable provisions of law. Your request was received in this office on 9/18/2025 and given the reference number F004675-091825 for tracking purposes. 

 

Your request will be processed in the order in which it was received.



You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed.

 


Please note, requests for reports or photographs require a separate request to Reports & Records.  Failure to submit a separate request to Reports & Records may result in response delays.




Department of Emergency Services and Public Protection

 

This transmission and any accompanying attachments may contain confidential or privileged information.  They are intended only for official use by the individual or entity named on this transmission.  If you are not the intended recipient, you are not authorized to disclose, copy, distribute or use, in any manner, the contents of this information.  If you have received this transmission in error, please notify us immediately. 


To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the DESPP Request Center



GovQA logo

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

john Conrad

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Stringfellow Barr
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request records on Stringfellow Barr. 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stringfellow_Barr

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mitch Poran

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the first thousand pages of records that your agency has on Moonlight Maze. Please keep in mind the amount of information on Moonlight Maze that has been publicly acknowledged by the US government, including that the Russian hacking group Turla is behind the Moonlight Maze cyberattack.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mitch Poran
